intro: Justicia internodialis, commonly known as the narrowleaf false arum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are often borne in clusters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The flowers are typically violet or purple in color, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
